help.markdown:
Puedes usar Markdown básico en este campo. Las siguientes opciones de formato están disponibles:

  • **negrita**
  • *itálica*
  • [enlaces](https://example.org)
  • párrafos
  • listas: 
    - entrada de lista
- entrada de lista
    1. lista ordenada
2. lista ordenada
help.banner: Banner: Colección de misiones que se han de completar seguidas para formar una imagen completa en tu perfil.
help.collection: Colección: Colección de misiones que se pueden completar en cualquier orden.

errors.noMissions: Un banner ha de contener al menos una misión aceptada
errors.numberOfMissions: Un banner ha de contener entre {{min}} y {{max}} misiones
errors.invalidIndex: Hay al menos una misión con índice inválido. Los índices han de ser enteros positivos
errors.titleLength: El título ha de tener entre {{min}} y {{max}} caracteres

warnings.incomplete: El banner podría estar incompleto ya que tiene agujeros
warnings.divisible: El banner podría estar incompleto ya que el número total de misiones no es divisible por el ancho seleccionado: {{width}}
warnings.length: El banner podría estar incompleto ya el número de misiones incluídas difiere del número total detectado en el título: {{length}}

algorithm.help:
Manual: El título se detectará automáticamente de las misiones. La numeración de las misiones se hará secuencial empezando por 1.

Automático: Detección automática del título del banner y la numeración de las misiones a partir del tíutlo de las misiones. Con banners muy largos puede ir lento.

  • Si la detección se cambia a automática, el título y la ordenación puede cambiar.
  • Si el título se modifica, no se cambiará automáticamente al añadir nuevas misiones.
  • Si se cambia el índice de alguna misión, se activará el modo manual.

time.title: Tiempo del juego
time.warning: No hay tiempo disponible ya que hay misiones no disponibles, faltan misiones o alguna misión no ha sido nunca completada.

question1.title: What is bannergress.com?
question1.answer:
After the horrific loss of our favorite Ingress fan page, some agents came together to start this project. The aim of the project is to:

  • get everyone involved
  • be open source
  • be the long-term solution for finding banners
  • never stop developing

question2.title: How do I get Ingress missions to bannergress.com? (Part 1: setup)
question2.answer:
1. Install IITC-CE (Recommendation: IITC Button browser add-on)
  2. Install the bannergress plugin
    Caution: If you use a userscript manager parallel to the IITC browser add-on, you’re getting two tabs with installations; Install the plugin in the IITC Button view tab
  3. Click on the IITC icon in your browser and make sure the following two plugins are active:
    • Misc > Bannergress
    • Info > Missions
  4. Refresh (F5) your IITC
  5. Open Bannergress settings
    You can find this link at the end of the right sidebar
  6. You have to log in first with your Google account
    Click on Log in button

Now you are ready to scan missions! (Part 2)

question3.title: How do I get Ingress missions to bannergress.com? (Part 2: scan missions)
question3.answer:
1. Open your IITC-CE
  2. Go to the area which you want to scan
  3. Zoom very closely in mission dense areas
    Caution: Only Top 25 missions will be shown!
  4. Open Missions in view
    You can find this link at the end of the right sidebar
  5. A new window with Bannergress utilities on the top and a mission list including status (Only Top 25!) should be opened.
    Now you can scan the missions in different ways:
    • The fastest way to get many missions uploaded is to Process all!
    • If you explicitly want to upload one banner: use the Filter by mission name
    • You can also upload single missions with the 🠋 on the right
  6. Navigate with the map controls (“N”, “E”, S”, “W”) and repeat step 5
    We do get only missions if you hit a button!

question4.title: How can I add a banner to bannergress?
question4.answer:
1. You have to be logged in
  2. You can find Submit a new banner on our landing page (Home)
  3. New banner
      Add Missions:
      search for the banner name or author.
      Pro Tip: You can use % for a placeholder
      You can add all or add specific missions with the ➔
      Arrange:
      The website tries to arrange the missions automatically.
      You can always edit the mission numbers manually.
      If the missions can be finished in any order, check the advanced options in information
      Information:
      Please check the banner title, description and preview.
      Click on Review
      Review:
      You can see all banner information. If you are happy, click Submit Banner

question5.answer:
...the mission creator?

...the IITC-CE?

...the bannergress plugin?

...an IITC plugin which shows more than the Top 25 missions?

question6.title: How do I get my own Ingress missions to bannergress.com, using the Ingress Mission Creator?
question6.answer:
1. You need either the IITC Button browser add-on or Tampermonkey.
  2. Install the bannergress creator plugin.
  3. Open the mission creator (you may be asked to log into your Ingress account). Then, click on “Sync with Bannergress” in the menu (you may be asked to log into your Bannergress account).

question7.title: How can I edit my own banners?
question7.answer:
Bannergress needs to know your Ingress agent name before it can provide you with edit permissions:
  1. Sign into Bannergress.
  2. Open your Bannergress account page.
  3. Click on "Link Ingress Account" and follow the instructions.
After that, you have an edit button on all banners that you own.
